SENT.plain: Tryptophan catabolism, which is mediated by the enzymes indoleamine 2,3-dioxygenase (IDO) and tryptophan 2,3-dioxygenase (TDO), produces kynurenine
Kynurenine itself is converted by downstream enzymes into secondary catabolites
We evaluated the serum levels of primary and secondary tryptophan catabolites in a cohort of patients with myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS)
The MDS patients showed significantly higher levels tryptophan catabolites which correlated with cytopenia
The tryptophan catabolites inhibited progenitor expansion during the in vitro culture of hematopoietic cells
Thus, MDS patients are characterized by high tryptophan catabolism resulting in elevated primary and secondary metabolites, which both have inhibitory effects on hematopoiesis
